sn1.32:1.1: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Savatthi in Jeta’s Grove, Anathapiṇḍika’s Park.
sn1.32:1.2: Then, when the night had advanced, a number of devatās belonging to the Satullapa host, of stunning beauty, illuminating the entire Jeta’ s Grove, approached the Blessed One. Having approached, they paid homage to the Blessed One and stood to one side.
sn1.32:1.3: Then one devatā, standing to one side, recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn1.32:3.1: Then another devatā recited these verses in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn1.32:4.1: “That which the miser fears when he does not give
sn1.32:4.2: Is the very danger that comes to the nongiver.
sn1.32:4.6: in this world and the next.
sn1.32:5.2: The conqueror of the stain should give a gift.
sn1.32:5.4: Deeds of merit are the support for living beings
sn1.32:6.1: Then another devatā recited these verses in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn1.32:7.1: “They do not die among the dead
sn1.32:7.2: Who, like fellow travellers on the road,
sn1.32:7.3: Provide though they have but a little:
sn1.32:8.1: “Some provide from the little they have,
sn1.32:8.2: Others who are affluent don’t like to give.
sn1.32:8.3: An offering given from what little one has
sn1.32:8.4: Is worth a thousand times its value.
sn1.32:9.1: Then another devatā recited these verses in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn1.32:10.1: Who give what is hard to give
sn1.32:10.2: And do deeds hard to do:
sn1.32:10.3: “The bad do not emulate the good,
sn1.32:10.4: The Dhamma of the good is hard to follow.
sn1.32:11.1: Differs for the good and the bad:
sn1.32:11.2: The bad go to hell, The good are bound for heaven.
sn1.32:12.1: Then another devatā said to the Blessed One: “Which one,
sn1.32:13.1: “You have all spoken well in a way. But listen to me too:
sn1.32:14.1: “If one practises the Dhamma Though getting on by gleaning,
sn1.32:14.2: If while one supports one’s wife One gives from the little one has,
sn1.32:14.3: Then a hundred thousand offerings Of those who sacrifice a thousand
sn1.32:14.4: Are not worth even a fraction Of the gift of one like him. ”
sn1.32:15.1: Then another devatā addressed the Blessed One in verse:
sn1.32:16.1: “Why does their sacrifice, vast and grand,
sn1.32:16.2: Not share the value of the righteous one’s gift?
sn1.32:16.3: Why are a hundred thousand offerings
sn1.32:16.4: Of those who sacrifice a thousand Not worth even a fraction Of the gift of one like him?”
sn1.32:17.1: “Since they give while settled in unrighteousness,
sn1.32:17.2: Having slain and killed, causing sorrow,
sn1.32:17.4: Shares not the value of the righteous one’s gift.
sn1.32:18.1: That is why a hundred thousand offerings
sn1.32:18.2: Of those who sacrifice a thousand Are not worth even a fraction Of the gift of one like him.
